ratings.comment: This prof is amazing, and he's really famous. He's the founders of public broadcasting and knows everything about media history and journalism practice. I'm really glad I took this course.

JMitch is the man. Seriously one of the coolest dudes on campus. Show up to class and remember key ideas like John Dewey's market place of ideas and the class is a breeze. The readings are very interesting, but only very important on days that you present them.

JMitch is an adorable old man who doesn't really have a filter. His lectures are kind of long and boring but he's so fun to listen to. He gets off track A LOT. The assignments don't really have guidelines and he's a tough grader ("I don't really give A's") but you will not regret taking this class.

This class is super boring and everything is graded by the T.A. If you get Jamie Fisher and she doesn't like you watch out because she'll take it out on your grades for the rest of the semester. Take this class in the spring with the other Prof. I heard it's much better.

I think this class should be curved because everything that's graded in this class is graded by your TA.  Since not all TA's grade the exact same, the class should be curved to even out the grading diferences.

95% of the time the lectures are fun and interesting.  A few boring ones are thrown into the mix.  The essay exams can be easy or hard depending on which question is chosen.  HE likes to pull questions for readings, readings that you didn't discuss in class.....

Very respectful and intelligent man. You don't need to go to lectures (all his notes are posted online) but you should just because they actually are interesting. I ended the semester feeling like I learned a lot from him, which is more than I can say about any of my other professors.

Jack is awesome! His insight on the profession is super helpful. the lectures were always well thought out. the exams aren't to hard. overall, the structure of the course is really good and insightful

Surprisingly easy and exciting. The hour+ discussion isn't as intimidating as it sounds. I HATE speeches and these 2 were super easy. 1 of them isn't even graded. Papers are fun to write and essay exams are easy as long as you make a brief outline of the notes and talk with other students. I got 100% on both. I highly recommend this course.

A profoundly important figure in the history of American journalism. It was interesting taking a class with him and hearing his thoughts about the purpose of journalism. He was really friendly and nice too! I think he just retired but it was cool to take a class with someone who like invented what I want to do.

He was certainly influential in American journalism back in the day... However, the field of journalism is changing.  He has a really bleak outlook for the future of journalism and for journalists.  Overall, not a hard class.  You really don't need to read, just gather some main ideas.  I've heard Downey is a much better professor.

This class was a whole lot of nothing.  Jack likes to muse on rhetorical questions, and rarely takes a stance on topics. Otherwise, he's talking about things that won't show up on the midterms. Discussion is fun, if you like public speaking, but paper writing is boring and depending on the TA, tedious. Know philosophers and their ideas...that's it.
Easy to get a B in this class due to the curve. However, not recommended to those who are not interested in journalism. Somewhat the lectures are not that enthusiastic.

Keeps lectures lively and interesting. Very knowledgable in his field and I learned quite a bit in this course. Sometimes lectures felt a little repetitive, but overall a great course and a great professor.

Can tell he is enthusiastic about what he is talking about, considering he was an integral part of a lot of it.  A lot of time to complete papers, so thats not too bad.  Exams were extremely difficult, you have to prepare outlines for 6-10 essay questions and he picks 1-2.  Curved so almost everybody gets a B

I found 75% of the lectures to be pretty boring and they didn't flow very well.You can only lose 30 points to get an A. My TA gave out one A in both of his sections.  It is however very easy to get an AB or B.  I'm not a fan of journalism so I didn't enjoy it, plus it ruined my 4.0 so I'm kinda bitter. I'd take it with Downy if you want an A.

Jack's a decent lecturer but it's a shame that the material he was teaching got progressively more boring, useless, irrelevant, and general over the course of the semester. I felt like he was making stuff up by the end. He should've focused more on media theorists. Easy A if you know how to write, but don't expect to come out having learned much.

Really good lecturer...enthusiastic and makes things interesting.  Unfortanetely, this class depends on discussion and most of the TAs aren't good.  Also, none of the stuff in lecture goes with the stuff in discussion.

Jack Mitchell is the man! he makes lectures funny and engaging. Makes the topic interesting and easy to understand for those who have no interest in journalism. A good comm b class to take if you can get him. This guy really knows what he is talking about.

This guy is completely out of touch. He can't even work is laptop, and this is bad news when you're teaching a journalism class. Also, Mitchell wastes students' time. On three separate occasions, he said he had arranged for a guest lecturer that never showed up. Guest's fault? Doubtful. Mitchell's the common denominator. Useless.

His 335 section is better than some of the others because you actually do reporting the whole time instead of powerpoint lectures and in-class stuff. You basically pracitce reporing on issues that starting news and feature writers tend to do. Class isn't too hard as long as you aren't careless.

Lectures are engaging, funny, and very easy to follow thanks to a provided fill-in-the-blanks outline. The content is very opinion-based, but he works off of credible media theorists and documentaries. Ultimately the easiness of the class comes down to how hard your TA is on your essays and speeches, since they're your entire grade.
loved this class! awesome professor

really easy class. i had the hardest ta and still got an a. go to lecture and take good notes, you wont use them until the midterm/final. luckily, my friend let me use his. never went to class, never did the readings. just go to discussion and participate and do your papers!

The lecture itself was extremely boring but he posts partial notes beforehand. I had him for discussion also, and he's very renown and intelligent, but it isn't always clear exactly what he wants from you. If you like journalism take this class, but if you're not interested the semester will be extremely boring.

If you have any interest in journalism, take someone else.  If you are just trying to take a com b and take a fairly easy class, but have no interest in journaliam, or even learning for that matter, take this overly-opnionated prof who is too egotistical about his stupid radio show to base his class on fact.
He wanders a little in lecture, but has a good sense of humor. Informative, overall good class.

Good professor. Lectures can be a little dry sometimes, but its not the end of the world if you miss one as long as a friend took notes for you.  If you want to get into the J School, Mitchell is the way to go for 201

He rambles a lot, which makes lectures seem pointless. He provides fill in the blank outlines for his lectures, so note taking is really easy. The exams are much more difficult than should be since the material he presents is irrelevant and disjointed. Not a good introductory professor.

This classed is based heavily on his opinions rather than facts.  Class is bassed off of steriotypes and trivial general perceptions of the professor.  If you actually want to learn fract rather than opinion, take it from someone else.

Interesting lectures offered by a very approachable guy.  Definitely one of the better profs in the J-school.  You're totally screwed if you get a bad TA, though, as they grade your papers, so pay close attention to what your jerk radar tells you during your first discussion.

Jack is the man, his lectures were great and he is very available and pleasant to deal with...unfortunately this class is really dependent upon your TA since they are the ones who grade your papers. TA's make or break this class, i unfortunately got a difficult unpleasant TA but otherwise I really liked the class.
I really liked him and the lecture topics, but I HATED section, the papers, and the exams.  I guess it depends on the TA you get, though.

This man is THE professor to take, as he's an old-school journalist. The man wrote the book on Public Radio, LITERALLY. Interesting lectures, always very enthusiastic. The TA's are a toss-up however. Some are great resources, some are no help at all. If you get one of the less helpful ones, change sections, IMMEDIATELY.

The professor is a curmudgeon, but he's awesome anyway. Beware of the TA's in this class though, they're all really hard. Also, Jack's lectures never seen to pertain much to the 4 essay exams, so be SURE to do all the reading. Also, make sure to hit the lectures that have a guest! Those are important...

The lectures for this class are really interesting.  Prof. Mitchell is an amazing lecturer!!  The TAs and discussion section on the other hand aren't all that great.  It seems like you don't discuss lecture in discussion at all.  The class is challenging, but it isn't that hard to get a B out of it.
the man is absolutely amazing!!! i had him as a professor and a TA and hes the person who made me realize that i wanted to go into journalism as a career. i owe him so much!

Awesome teacher. He has such a wealth of knowledge about journalism and is so enthusiatsic aboout the subject. I had J201 and J646 (Ethics in Media) with him and wish I could have taken more. Talk to him after hours if you get the chance, you can learn so much from his experiences.
terrible. well, UW's journalism school is terrible, so i'm not that surprised. but avoid him anyway.

I went to about 1/3 of his lectures because he was incredibly boring, and I regret it because the informatin was extremely interesting.  Even though I barely ever went to class I still got an AB in the class and I don't even like writing.  He's a great guy and the TA's make the class a ton easier.  Great comm b filler, take it from him.

Mitchell is a fantastic professor. I had him for J201, J335 and I would take other classes with him if I could. He's a great person and one of the few old-school kick-ass journalists left alive. Fun drinking buddy too if you ever get the chance. Really one of the best professors I've ever had.

I loved this class.  Mitchell is a great teacher who really exhibits a lot of enthusiasm and love for his subject.  The tests were very straightforward and fair - he provides six possible essay questions in advance then determines the one he asks by a roll of the dice.

A really good professor and a good person to have on your side. He knows a lot about journalism...most importantly why people should go into this career-because you want to help "save the wolrd" he says. He's very positive, and has a witty sense of humor. Take j335 with him, it's worth it.

AWESOME teacher - very easy if you went to class. Notes were clealy laid out in power point, tests were easy if you actually looked at the questions throughly. My TA (Elliott Hillback) was a stickler for the way papers were "supposed" to be written, but Mitchell's a great prof - definetly recommend!

Great professor...lectures were interesting and the essay tests only covered a few lectures so not necessary to go to all even though you'll probably want to because his lectures are always funny. Also really helpful..I agree wait to get Mitchell for J201
I hated the tests I thought they were a horrible waste of everyone's time. But overall his teaching was good and the course has good content.
Really nice professor. He emphasizes that it's hard to get an A in the class, but an AB or B is definitely do-able. Lectures can be a little bit boring, but everything is really clear.
Easy tests, interesting lectures. Heard that he was better than all the other J201 teachers.
Lectures are interesting and you can get away doing only about a 10th of the actual readings.  If you're gonna take J201, wait for Mitchell, he's way better then the other J201 profs.
